prompt: <description>Part 1: A Rectangular Prism with a Pointed End Construct a rectangular prism with a pointed end. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.1154, 0.0]. Sketch the first face of the prism as a rectangle with two loops, each consisting of two straight lines. Loop 1 is defined by: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.1442, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.1442, 0.0], End Point [0.1442, 0.75] * Line 3: Start Point [0.1442, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Loop 2 is defined by: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0433, 0.2019], End Point [0.101, 0.2019] * Line 2: Start Point [0.101, 0.2019], End Point [0.101, 0.7212] * Line 3: Start Point [0.101, 0.7212], End Point [0.0433, 0.7212] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0433, 0.7212], End Point [0.0433, 0.2019] Extrude this face by a depth of 0.0361 towards the normal and 0.0361 in the opposite direction. The final shape has dimensions of approximately 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height, with the pointed end being approximately 0.5 units in length. Part 2: A Smaller Rectangular Prism Construct a smaller rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0361, 0.0793, 0.75]. Sketch the face of the prism as a rectangle with one loop consisting of four straight lines. Loop 1 is defined by: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0721, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.0721, 0.0], End Point [0.0721, 0.0721] * Line 3: Start Point [0.0721, 0.0721], End Point [0.0, 0.0721] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0721], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Extrude this face by a depth of 0.0 in the normal direction and 0.5481 in the opposite direction. The final shape has dimensions of approximately 0.0721 units in length and width, and 0.5481 units in height. Part 3: A Cylindrical Object Construct a cylindrical object. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.0505, 0.0433, 0.1226]. Sketch the face of the cylinder as a circle with one loop consisting of one circular arc. Loop 1 is defined by: * Circle 1: Center [0.0216, 0.0216], Radius 0.0216 Extrude this face by a depth of 0.0433 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction. The final shape has dimensions of approximately 0.0433 units in length, width, and height. The cylinder has a tapered top and a flat bottom.</description>
